results.title: The Little ark
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz and Cinema Center Films
results.brief_description: Two children in Holland, Jan Brink and Adinda de la Maison are orphaned after they are separated from their parents when a flood washes away their town. They are picked up by an Urker sea captain, along with the pets they have salvaged from the flood; a cat, rabbit, rooster and a dog. The captain proves to be a captivating story teller with the ability to teach values such as love and respect through his stories. Starring Monica Achterberg, Genevieve Ambas, Philip Frame and Theodore Bikel as the captain. Filmed entirely in Holland and based on the novel by Jan De Hartog.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz and Cinema Center Films

results.title: Amongst equals
results.creator_credit: Paul Hamfess, Tom Zubrycki and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the history of the Australian Trade Union Movement. The film is not endorsed by the ACTU and represents only the film maker’s view. The 1850s saw the introduction of the eight hour labour movement and the subsequent development of the trade union movement. Unions were established to organise, assert and defend the worker’s rights, industrial awards, occupational health and safety and minimum wages.

results.title: Connecting Towns: A South Gippsland Cluster
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.

results.title: The Life of Harry Dare (A)
results.creator_credit: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission and Infinity Pictures
results.brief_description: Harry Dare’s troubles began the day he sighted the Kombi van and despite the warnings of ‘Bad Spirit Trouble’, he just had to have it. When the van is stolen, Harry embarks on a journey with his young estranged son Jim to find it. What Harry really discovers is a more meaningful relationship with his son. Stars John Moore as Harry and Aaron Wilton as Jim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission and Infinity Pictures

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Visions of Victoria
results.creator_credit: Janne Martin Video Productions and Stewart Faichney
results.brief_description:
On a continent distinguished for its unique mixture of climates and for its exotic wildlife, there is no state that provides more variety and contrast than Victoria. Occupying the south-east corner of Australia, and only slightly larger than the size of Great Britain, Victoria has something for everybody. This video takes you on a remarkable tour of the state of Victoria which includes the wilderness areas of its world famous national parks, some of the best surf beaches in the world, Australia’s largest inland lagoon system, a rugged shipwrecked coast, winter resorts and high country, wetlands and even deserts. Also the vibrant and sophisticated city of Melbourne, renowned for its beautiful parks and gardens, exciting restaurants and nightlife, its devotion to the arts and, of course, a fanatical love of sports of all kinds. This superb video is a comprehensive celebration of this wonderful state, in all its beauty, seasons and moods.

Note: the end has a segment on film classification showing Bill Collins introducing the “G” rating.

results.title: Classic cars in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson Productions and Jeff Watson
results.brief_description: Featured in “My Car” on “The World Tonight” with Clive Robertson. In an age when all cars look the same, this video profiles the cars we would all like to own, or did own. Some of the cars features are the Austin Healy “Bug-Eye” Sprite, Austin 7, Ford Mustang, Jaguar SS, Mercedes-Benz 300SL “Gullwing”, Morris Minor, Volkswagen 1946, plus classic cars from the Repco Mountain Rally.

results.title: The Melbourne Games
results.creator_credit: James Murray, Denis Phelan, Video Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
Live through the unforgettable action for the first time the Olympic Flame blazed in the Southern Hemisphere. This program captures the momentous highs and lows Australians were able to savour first hand. It includes footage of the remarkable first, second and third places captured by Australian swimmers in the women’s 100m final, headed by the fabulous Dawn Fraser. The explosive confrontation between Hungarian and Russian water polo teams, less than three weeks after the Russian invasion. The pride of Betty Cuthbert’s glorious wins in the 100m, 200m and 4 x 100m relay races. Plus all the local magic of a youthful nation hosting the world’s premiere sporting competition. Narrated by Norman May.

results.title: Laurel Martyn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Laurel Martyn trained in London with Phyllis Bedells and was awarded a choreographic scholarship under the auspices of Ninette de Valois. In this interview, Martyn recalls the highlights of her performing career with the “Sadler’s Wells Ballet” in England and the “Borovansky Ballet” in Australia and discusses her teaching method and philosophy. Through her company, “Ballet Vistoria”, Martyn encouraged the development of a distinctively Australian style of dance and introduced ballet to thousands of school children. Researched and interviewed by James Murdoch.

results.title: Chocolates, giants and peaches. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Roald Dahl, recorded live at the Dallas Brooks Hall in Melbourne, talks about his writing and reads aloud from his own books, including Revolting Rhymes”, “BFG”, “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory”, “Matilda and “Dirty Beasts”.
